<0>Sur un site d√©di√© handicap tel que:
<0>On a job board dedicated to handicap, as Hanploi.com, you don't have to note it. There, recruiters are foremost looking for skills with the RQTH specificity.

<p>Un recruteur averti vous posera la qu:
A forewarned recruiter will ask the question: "can you benefit from the law of 2005 or do you have an RQTH?"

The question "do you require any workstation adjustments?" will follow.

If this question doesn't come up, you have the right not to talk about it.

C'est une fois que l'on a obtenu un entr: It is only after obtaining an interview with an employer that you can know exactly the kind of training that you'll need and in which city. Start by finding a company, rather than a training center, that will increase your chances of success.
C'est √† vous de d√©cider si vous voulez:
It's up to you to decide whether you want to mention your handicap on your CV. It's a personal choice that is yours to make. Yet, according to Hanploi: <1>

Don't specificy it, you would increase your chances to get an interview. And you'll always have the time to talk about it in person with the recruiter. It's your choice, but only if you feel like it and if you require a specific accomodation.

Otherwise, noone is forcing you to mention it. If the company has a "mission handicap", you will be able to mention it later, once your trial period has been validated.
It's up to you to decide whether you want to mention your handicap on your CV. Thinking about how the targeted employer would receive it is a good method to help you choose.

L'immersion professionnelle est un cadre: The professional immersion is a framework that allows you to do <1>a mini-internsip</1> in a company to discover what a job is about. The internship can last <3>between a few hours and 2 weeks</3>. During the immersion you are not paid but you are covered for any accident and you are coached by a tutor. His or her role is both to guide you in the company and help you assess your skills.
La Mission Locale vous aidera √† mettre: The Mission Locale will help you for the setup of the immersion. (They also might have some contacts in companies that could host you <1>üòâ</1>).

Selon Hanploi,<1><p>Par exp√©rience, il:
According to Hanploi,<1>

From experience, it's better to talk about your handicap before signing your work contract.

Today you might not need any workstation adjustments, but what about tomorrow?
Selon Hanploi¬†:<1><p>Une int√©gration r:
According to Hanploi:<1>

A good integration is key to successfully complete your probation period.

By defining your needs more precisely, your future employer will be able to prepare your integration in his/her team.

Without disclosing your handicap, he/she can explain your break, your workstation adjustments or any specific pieces of furniture made available to you.

Thus your colleagues will understand.
